column4: when I try to mount a nfs share i get "failed: RPC Error: Program not registered"
you need to install portmap
Installling portmap now
portmap is already installled
what command are you using to mount your remote nfs ?
http://pastebin.com/ztqJwHF2       tux is the username of both the PCs
ok, check that: http://tldp.org/HOWTO/NFS-HOWTO/troubleshooting.html (the  b. RPC: Program Not Registered: (or another "RPC" error) part)
try to run /usr/sbin/rpc.mountd on the server, maybe the daemon isn't running
plus, add -t nfs to your command to specify nfs to mount command
like sudo mount -t nfs 192.168.1.3:/home/tux/nfs /home/tux/nfs
tried starting the rpc.mountd , tried the - t nfs  but same thing .....Do I neeedto open ports on the server side ?
well, yes, if you have a firewall enabled? are you using iptables?
gufw enabled & I have allowed nfs as service
what is the content of /etc/host.allow on the server side?
give me too the content of /etc/exports on the server side
there are no entries there
the file is empty? do you have something in /etc/host.deny then?
same thing with hosts.deny there are no entries there only descriptions with # in the begining
well...
I'm sorry, I have no idea; but look, try to open a thread on the forum with all your informations (rpcinfo, files' contents, etc), maybe you'll find someone with more skills than me...
Okay/Thanks
